page.title: 07Swineshead Heritage Weekend
page.content: As Swineshead is a village with a wealth of historic buildings plus a beauty of its own, it was decided that in May 1985 to hold a Heritage Weekend. The aim was to use the beauty of the village for the church restoration fund. The weekend started on the Friday evening with a concert and an art exhibition, held in the church. Saturday and Sunday attractions included: a plant sale, tractor rides, demonstrations of crafts, a nature trail, Maypole dancing and afternoon teas. A special Swineshead cookery book of villagers favourite recipes was also produced and sold at the event. The whole weekend proved to be an enormous success showing what the village can acheive.
